Package bits.strings

Provides the classes necessary to specify a satisfiability problem involving bitstrings.

See: Description

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BitString
    An array of fixed length of IBooleanVariables.
    BitStringAlternator
    Constrains a BitString so that adjacent bits are negations of each other.
    BitStringAnder
    Constrains the IBitString Z to be the bitwise AND of IBitString X and IBitString Y.
    BitStringArrayBasiser
    C is a collection of IBitStrings, each of size n.
    BitStringArrayCoverer
    Given a collection C of BitStrings each of size n, does there exist a subset of C such that the bitwise OR of the members of the subset evaluate to the BitString 111...1 of size n?
    BitStringArrayDistincter  
    BitStringArraySplitter
    Two constraints are imposed by this IProblem:
    BitStringBitAnder
    Given a collection C of IBitStrings of equal size, and a bit position pos, constrain targetBitString to be the AND of the members of C for which bit position pos is true.
    BitStringBitAtomer  
    BitStringBitFixer
    Constrains the IBooleanVariable at position bit of IBitString b to equal the boolean value val.
    BitStringClearer
    Constrains all IBooleanVariables of IBitString b to equal the boolean value false.
    BitStringConcatenator
    Constrains IBitString Z to be the concatenation of IBitStrings X and Y.
    BitStringConditionalAnder  
    BitStringConditionalOrer
    Given a collection C of IBitStrings each of size n, and an IBitString targetBitString of size n, does there exist a subset of C such that the bitwise OR of the members of the subset evaluate to targetBitString?
    BitStringDisjointer  
    BitStringDominator  
    BitStringEqualizer
    Constrains IBitString X to equal IBitString Y.
    BitStringExchanger
    Constrains xAfter==yBefore and yAfter==xBefore.
    BitStringFixer
    An extension of the Problem class which imposes a constraint on an IBitString.
    BitStringHighPopper
    An extension of the Problem class which constrains parameter Y to equal the IBitString obtained when the bit of highest index in X is dropped.
    BitStringIntersector
    Satisfied when X[i]==true and Y[i]==true for some i.
    BitStringLowPopper
    An extension of the Problem class which constrains parameter Y to equal the IBitString obtained when the bit of lowest index in X is dropped.
    BitStringMapper  
    BitStringNonDominator
    Satisfied when X is not dominated by Y.
    BitStringNoter
    For each position bit in IBitString X, the corresponding IBooleanVariable is constrained to equal the negation of its counterpart in IBitString Y.
    BitStringOrderer
    An extension of the Problem class which imposes a sort relation on two IBitString.
    BitStringOrer  
    BitStringPermuter  
    BitStringSetter  
    BitStringSingleClearer
    For any positive integer n, if X_0, X_1, X_2, ...
    BitStringSingleSetter
    For any positive integer n, if X_0, X_1, X_2, ...
    BitStringSizedCoverer  
    BitStringsSingularDifferencer  
    BitStringSubstringer  
    BitStringSubtractor
    Constrains the IBitString Z to be the bitwise subtraction of IBitString Y from IBitString X.
    BitStringUnequalizer  
    BitStringXorer  
    BitStringZerothBitFixer  
    ConditionalConjunction
    Returns an IProblem that is satisfied if and only if all of the following IProblems are satisfied:
    ConditionalDisjunction
    Returns an IProblem that is satisfied if and only if at least one of the following IProblems is satisfied:
    HittingBitStringer
    Does there exist an IBitString hittingSet such that for every C[i], there exists some integer pos[i] such that hittingSet and C[i] have IBooleanVariables at position pos[i] that evaluate to true?
    MinimumTestSetter  
    RangeSubset  
    TestSetter  

Package bits.strings Description

Provides the classes necessary to specify a satisfiability problem involving bitstrings.
Since:
2005/10/27
